title: Fix FindCuDNN.cmake to look environment variable correctly
body_html:
1. Fix FindCuDNN.cmake to look environment variable correctly
  2. cosmetic changes
  3. I propose to add support of CUDNN_ROOT_DIR environment variable.

ref. https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/command/if.html for 1.

if(<variable|string>)
True if given a variable that is defined to a value that is not a false constant. False otherwise. (Note macro arguments are not variables.)

This means that if($ENV{CUDNN_INCLUDE_DIR}) requires a variable defined by the value of env variable must exist. But, a variable whose name is like a directory path does not exist.

Use if(DEFINED <variable>) instead.

Please let me know if 3. is not acceptable. I will revert it.

body:
1. Fix FindCuDNN.cmake to look environment variable correctly
2. cosmetic changes
3. I propose to add support of CUDNN_ROOT_DIR environment variable.

ref. https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/command/if.html for 1.

> if(<variable|string>)
> True if given a variable that is defined to a value that is not a false constant. False otherwise. (Note macro arguments are not variables.)

This means that `if($ENV{CUDNN_INCLUDE_DIR})` requires a variable defined by the value of env variable must exist. But, a variable whose name is like a directory path does not exist.

Use `if(DEFINED <variable>)` instead.

Please let me know if 3. is not acceptable. I will revert it.
